hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Stress Transition via Momentum Divergence & Volume Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: In BULL regimes, when BTC makes a new 30-day high on declining RSI (14-day) divergence AND experiences a volume spike (>150% of 20-day average) without significant price advancement (<2% gain on spike day), entering short positions captures the impending transition to STRESS regime as momentum fails.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bull regimes end with distribution. High volume without progress indicates smart money exiting. RSI divergence confirms weakening momentum. This combination often precedes sharp corrections and stress conditions.
entry_conditions: 14-day RSI shows lower high vs. previous price high (divergence)
Enter short on next daily open

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10% profit OR regime shifts to STRESS with confidence > 70%
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC closes above the divergence high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Such divergence patterns resolve upward with continuation >55% of the time in bull regimes rather than triggering stress.
